goal.goal: Sequentially define, validate, and execute the development process itself as TAL syntax.

note.overview: This defines the goal of representing system development as structured TAL syntax.
note.function: Enables consistent, semantic interpretation and structurable automation across development phases.

note.overview: This phase gathers the fundamental context and user expectations for the project.
note.function: It captures high-level intent and aligns user goals into structured inputs.

steps: Convert natural language into TALC-SA syntax
Define stakeholders, functional and non-functional requirements

note.overview: Transforms unstructured input into semantically framed TALC-SA syntax.
note.function: Establishes the foundational structure for system understanding and design.

steps: Analyze semantic flow and detect gaps using TALC-Review
phase_flow.output: Review feedback and syntax correction points

note.overview: Simulates user interaction and logic flow based on structured syntax.
note.function: Provides feedback to refine semantic consistency and user experience assumptions.

steps: Revise TALC-SA syntax based on Review feedback

note.overview: Applies Review-derived insights to improve the original syntax.
note.function: Ensures that semantic structures reflect both system logic and user interaction needs.

steps: Generate a requirements document from TALC-SA syntax
Review and confirm contents with the user

note.overview: Finalizes the mutual understanding of system expectations.
note.function: Validates the TALC-structured requirements before moving into UI design.

steps: Discuss screen layout and operational flow with user

note.overview: Gathers UI design needs directly from the user.
note.function: Lays the groundwork for interface structuring using TALC.

steps: Generate TALC-UI syntax from UI specifications
Define screen, API, and database designs

note.overview: Encodes UI, data, and interaction logic into TALC structure.
note.function: Produces a complete interface model aligned with prior requirements.

steps: Check structural and behavioral consistency of the design
phase_flow.output: Alignment report and syntax correction points

note.overview: Verifies interface logic against user experience principles.
note.function: Highlights structural issues and suggests enhancements.

steps: Revise UI syntax based on Review feedback

note.overview: Finalizes UI semantic structure incorporating Review revisions.
note.function: Completes the design-ready TALC representation of the interface.

steps: Generate system design documentation from UI syntax and present to user

note.overview: Presents complete system design in human-readable form.
note.function: Prepares the ground for implementation based on validated structure.

steps: Generate code skeleton based on syntax and begin development

note.overview: Initiates system construction from validated TAL structures.
note.function: Bridges the design-syntax with working implementation.
